intro: Gaudichaudia symplecta, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. The plant features showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are often hairy. Gaudichaudia symplecta is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in dry climates.
